Class RequestBuilder

java.lang.Object
ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api.request.RequestBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
public abstract class RequestBuilder extends Object implements RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>

  • Method Details

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, RequestBody<?> body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request.
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is a request body
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with empty body
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, byte[] body, int length, int offset)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with binary body
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is a full binary array
      length - is length of a sub-array to send
      offset - the offset of the first byte
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, byte[] body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with binary body
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is a binary array body
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is a file to send
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, Path body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with file to send
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is a path to a file to send
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, String body, Charset encoding)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with string body
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is an original string content
      encoding - is necessary encoding of of a body
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

      body - is an original string content
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, InputStream body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with stream body
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is an input stream body
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, Supplier<InputStream> body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with stream body. It is considered that an input stream is created at the moment when http request is sent
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is an input stream body. It is considered that an input stream is created at the moment when http request is sent
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, FormParameter... body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with body of application/x-www-form-urlencoded format.
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - array of form parameters
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper, Object body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request. An object is transformed into json/xml string body.
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      mapper - is an instance of ObjectMapper that is used to transform object into json/xml string
      body - object to be serialized
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, DefaultMapper mapper, Object body)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request. An object is transformed into json/xml string body.
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      mapper - creates/gets an instance of ObjectMapper that is used by default to transform object into json/xml string.
      body - object to be serialized
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.
      See Also:
      • DefaultMapper
      • DefaultJsonObjectMapper
      • DefaultXmlObjectMapper

    • POST

      public static RequestBuilder POST(URI endPoint, String boundary, BodyPart... parts)
      Creates a builder of a POST http request with multipart body.
      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      boundary - is a boundary between body parts
      parts - are parts of multipart body
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

    • POST

      Parameters:
      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      parts - are parts of multipart body
      Returns:
      a POST request builder.

      endPoint - is a target endpoint
      body - is an original string content
      encoding - is necessary encoding of of a body
      Returns:
      a fluent http request builder.

    • expectContinue

      public RequestBuilder expectContinue(boolean enable)
      Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
      Requests the server to acknowledge the request before sending the body. This is disabled by default. If enabled, the server is requested to send an error response or a 100 Continue response before the client sends the request body. This means the request publisher for the request will not be invoked until this interim response is received.

      Description was taken from Java documents.
      Specified by:
      expectContinue in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
      Parameters:
      enable - true if Expect continue to be sent
      Returns:
      instance of T

    • version

      public RequestBuilder version(java.net.http.HttpClient.Version version)
      Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
      Sets the preferred HttpClient.Version for this request.

      The corresponding HttpResponse should be checked for the version that was actually used. If the version is not set in a request, then the version requested will be that of the sending HttpClient.

      Description was taken from Java documents.
      Specified by:
      version in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
      Parameters:
      version - the HTTP protocol version requested
      Returns:
      instance of T

    • header

      public RequestBuilder header(String name, String... values)
      Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
      Adds the given name value pair to the set of headers for this request. The given value is added to the list of values for that name.

      Description was taken from Java documents.
      Specified by:
      header in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      values - the header values
      Returns:
      instance of T
      See Also:
      • RFC 7230 section-3.2

    • timeout

      public RequestBuilder timeout(Duration duration)
      Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
      Sets a timeout for this request. If the response is not received within the specified timeout then an HttpTimeoutException is thrown from HttpClient::send or HttpClient::sendAsync completes exceptionally with an HttpTimeoutException. The effect of not setting a timeout is the same as setting an infinite Duration, ie. block forever.

      Description was taken from Java documents.
      Specified by:
      timeout in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
      Parameters:
      duration - the timeout duration
      Returns:
      instance of T

    • queryParam

      public RequestBuilder queryParam(String name, FormValueDelimiters delimiter, boolean allowReserved, Object... values)
      Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
      Appends query parameter. Appends query parameter. It gets value of the parameter joined into one string, where given values are separated by delimiter.
      Specified by:
      queryParam in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
      Parameters:
      name - parameter name
      delimiter - is a delimiter/separator of values.
      allowReserved - means to percent-encode reserved characters or not. It keeps these characters not encoded when given value is true
      values - array of values of the the parameter. The method is designed to accept primitive values, objects of primitive wrappers, strings, arrays and collections of mentioned types. Any value may contain non ASCII characters.
      Returns:
      instance of T

    • queryParam

      public RequestBuilder queryParam(String name, boolean allowReserved, Object... values)
      Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
      Appends query parameter. It explodes multiple value of the parameter by default.
      Specified by:
      queryParam in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
      Parameters:
      name - parameter name
      allowReserved - means to percent-encode reserved characters or not. It keeps these characters not encoded when given value is true
      values - array of values of the the parameter. The method is designed to accept primitive values, objects of primitive wrappers, strings, arrays and collections of mentioned types. Any value may contain non ASCII characters.
      Returns:
      instance of T

      Parameters:
      tuners - classes of objects that help to prepare resulted http request. Defined classes should declare no constructor or these classes should have a constructor with no parameter.
